page.title: 05Housing in Newport.
page.content: I live in a bungalow in Maes Ingli,a new Council estate of houses which includes a block of Old People's flats.Maes Morfa and Maes Curig in Parrog Road are also groups of Council houses,but some people are now buying their Council homes. The older houses are built of local stone mined from Carn Ingli.Many owners are now stripping off the plastering and the very old cottages in particular look really nice.I think all the houses should have stone fronts.Most houses built today are bungalows.Our Castle is now a private dwelling. About one house in every three is only used in the summer when we see big cars with surf-boards and boats outside.I would like to live in one but they are too expensive I think.I am sad when I see them in winter.
